title: Carabao Cup shocks and the death of Sahar Khodayari – Football Weekly Extra
text:
Max Rushden , Barry Glendenning , Paul MacInnes and Marcus Bean on the latest lurch south by Spurs, Pep Guardiola’s response to the Bernardo Silva incident, young players, debutants and the devastating case of ‘Blue Girl’

Join the conversation on Facebook, Twitter and email.

We discuss the third round of the Carabao Cup, starting with the shocks, as Tottenham, West Ham, Bournemouth and Stoke are dumped out by lower-league opposition.

We look at the rest of the results, stopping to consider Pep Guardiola’s response to the criticism Bernardo Silva has faced for comparing a picture of his teammate Benjamin Mendy to a company logo which has been widely criticised as being a racist caricature.

At the top of part three, we speak to Maryam Shojaei, an Iranian football fan and activist, who tells us about the campaign to change the law in Iran to allow women into football stadiums, and about the death of ‘Blue Girl’, Sahar Khodayari, who set herself on fire outside a court in Tehran after being arrested for attempting to gain access to a stadium to see the team she supports.

Back on Monday. Along with comments, hopefully.
